pullRequest.body:
I prove that tensor product of Azumaya algebra is still Azumaya, this PR is a prerequisite.

---

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message

- ...

Deletions:

- ...

:v: Whysoserioushah can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+
Canceled.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13207909934/job/36875330804)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13207909934/job/36875330552)
untested but I think should work:

```suggestion
noncomputable abbrev tensorEquivEnd : R âŠ—[R] Ráµáµ’áµ– â‰ƒâ‚[R] Module.End R R :=
```
Similar below.

```suggestion
instance self : IsAzumaya R R where
```

```suggestion
theorem of_commRing : IsAzumaya R R where
```
or perhaps
```suggestion
theorem _root_.CommRing.toIsAzumaya : IsAzumaya R R where
```

This name seems to suggest that either any commutative algebra is Azumaya, or that `R` is an Azumaya over `R` only when `R` is commutative. The former is false, and the latter seems off because I don't think there is a good notion of Azumaya algebra over a non-commutative base.
I'll just leave it for now

> I'll just leave it for now

What does this mean?

> > I'll just leave it for now
> 
> What does this mean?

I mean I'll hold off the change till we finish the discussion on the name :-(
Maybe `IsAzumaya.id` in analogy to [Algebra.id](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Algebra/Defs.html#Algebra.id).
Sounds good I'll change
changed!

```suggestion
  bij := by rw [â† tensorEquivEnd_eq_mulLeftRight]; exact tensorEquivEnd R |>.bijective
```
Probably should be called `mulLeftRight_comp_congr` or something similar.
changed!
This should be moved elsewhere, and I think `LinearEquiv` is enough?
where do you think I shold move it to?
Also it seems AlgEquiv is necessary I need both map_smul and map_one

The result is true for linear equivs. An injection might even be enough. You need a different proof though. 
Where does `#min_imports` suggest you put it?
`#min_imports` says `Mathlib.GroupTheory.GroupAction.Hom`?
Yeah seems to make sense.
moved!

```suggestion
theorem of_AlgEquiv (e : A â‰ƒâ‚[R] B) [IsAzumaya R A] : IsAzumaya R B :=
```
And you probably shouldn't mention `hA` in the proof.
You should add a lemma `AlgHom.mulLeftRight_bijective` that has `[IsAzumaya R A]` as an assumption.
added
I think this holds for any nontrivial free module?
generalised!

```suggestion
lemma coe_tensorEquivEnd : tensorEquivEnd R = AlgHom.mulLeftRight R R := by
```
since there is a coercion on (at least) the LHS.
done!

```suggestion
abbrev AlgHom.mulLeftRightMatrix_inv :
    Module.End R (Matrix n n R) â†’â‚—[R] Matrix n n R âŠ—[R] (Matrix n n R)áµáµ’áµ– where
```

```suggestion
variable (R A B : Type*) [CommSemiring R] [Ring A] [Ring B] [Algebra R A] [Algebra R B]
```
changed!

```suggestion
variable (R n : Type*) [CommSemiring R] [Fintype n] [DecidableEq n]
```
changed!

```suggestion
theorem Matrix [Nonempty n]: IsAzumaya R (Matrix n n R) where
```
changed, turns out I need `[Nonempty n]` and `[Nontrivial R]`

Does this generalize to 
```suggestion
abbrev AlgHom.mulLeftRightInv (b : Basis n R A) :
    Module.End R A â†’â‚—[R] A âŠ—[R] Aáµáµ’áµ– where
```
It's not true that every finite-dimensional nontrivial algebra over a field is Azumaya (equivalently, central simple) ...
yeah I don't think it could be generalised that far

Yeah I think the usefulness of this map in the matrix case comes from the fact that e.g. e_{ij} * e_{jk} = e_{ik} for the chosen basis, which won't be true in general. Note that the definition here involves e_ij, e_{jk} and e_{kl} so I don't think we can extrapolate. In general if we have a basis f_n then we're looking for the inverse to a map sending (f_i tensor f_j) to the function sending f_k to f_i f_k f_j and in general this has no nice form.
This belongs in another file. Does it generalize to broader classes of `Module`?

Here [DecidableEq Î¹] and [Nontrivial R] should definitely be removed. When [Subsingleton R] is assumed you don't even need to assume [Nonempty Î¹] (make sure to mark it @[nontriviality]). You can make a version assuming `Basis Î¹ R M` too. Another direction of generalization is to assume [FaithfulSMul R M] and conclude `FaithfulSMul R (Î¹ â†’â‚€ M)`.
As for "classes of `Module`" I don't think there's much beyond nontrivial free modules. For example, the action of `R Ã— S` on the projective `R Ã— S`-module `R Ã— 0` is not faithful if S is nontrivial.
removed!

```suggestion
instance (M : Type*) [AddCommMonoid M] [Module R M] [Module.Free R M] [Nontrivial M] :
```

```suggestion
- `IsAzumaya.id`: `R` is an Azumaya algebra over itself.
```

Why not
```suggestion

lemma AlgHom.mulLeftRight_bij [h : IsAzumaya R A] :
    Function.Bijective (AlgHom.mulLeftRight R A) := h.bij
```
?

```suggestion
    (hf : Function.Injective f) :
```

Probably you should use MulActionHomClass so it applies to LinearMap and AlgHom too?
For MulActionHom there's this [notation](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/3eb0ff709449ce0401b0032e17d61dd0f5d51b46/Mathlib/GroupTheory/GroupAction/Hom.lean#L101-L105).
changed to mulactionhomclass!

```suggestion
  by sending `f` to `âˆ‘áµ¢â±¼â‚–â‚— f(Eâ±¼â‚–)áµ¢â‚— â€¢ Eáµ¢â±¼âŠ—Eâ‚–â‚—`. -/
```
or maybe clearer as
```suggestion
  by sending `f` to `âˆ‘áµ¢â‚—â‚›â‚œ f(Eâ‚›â‚œ)áµ¢â‚— â€¢ Eáµ¢â‚›âŠ—Eâ‚œâ‚—`. -/
```
Better to use LaTeX for code that isn't valid lean syntax I think
how do I type latex code in docstring, is it just by adding `$$`?

For module docstrings I would be inclined to agree here, because "module docstrings are usually viewed in the docs" (in my opinion). But for theorem docstrings I'm less convinced, because "theorem docstrings are usually viewed in VS Code via hover" (in my opinion) and LaTeX does not render in this case, so most people viewing this are going to see `sum_{i,j,s,t} f(E_{s,t})_{i,l} \cdot E_{i,s}\tensor E_{t,l}` which I think looks much worse.

maintainer delegate
but please resolve this before merge

bors d+

@Whysoserioushah please fix the comments before merging.
sorry I didn't see this
looks like junyan did it for me so I'm resolving this

```suggestion
/-- A nontrivial matrix ring over `R` is an Azumaya algebra over `R`. -/
theorem matrix [Nonempty n] [Nontrivial R] : IsAzumaya R (Matrix n n R) where
```
`Nontrivial R` is also not necessary here. Probably easiest to use the `Basis` version of the FaithfulSMul instance.
removed

```suggestion
  toFun f := âˆ‘ âŸ¨âŸ¨i, jâŸ©, k, lâŸ© : (n Ã— n) Ã— n Ã— n,
    f (stdBasisMatrix j k 1) i l â€¢ (stdBasisMatrix i j 1) âŠ—â‚œ[R] op (stdBasisMatrix k l 1)
  map_add' f1 f2 := by simp [add_smul, Finset.sum_add_distrib]
  map_smul' r f := by simp [MulAction.mul_smul, Finset.smul_sum]
```

```suggestion
  eq_of_smul_eq_smul {_ _} h := eq_of_smul_eq_smul fun m â†¦ hf <| by simp_rw [map_smul, h]
```

```suggestion
  eq_of_smul_eq_smul := by nontriviality R; exact instFaithfulSMulOfFreeOfNontrivial R _ |>.1
  bij := Function.bijective_iff_has_inverse.mpr
    âŸ¨AlgHom.mulLeftRightMatrix_inv R n,
    DFunLike.congr_fun (AlgHom.mulLeftRightMatrix.inv_comp R n),
    DFunLike.congr_fun (AlgHom.mulLeftRightMatrix.comp_inv R n)âŸ©
```

```suggestion
instance (Î¹ : Type*) [Nonempty Î¹] : FaithfulSMul R (Î¹ â†’â‚€ R) :=
  .ofInjective (Finsupp.lsingle <| Classical.arbitrary _) (Finsupp.single_injective _)

instance (M : Type*) [AddCommMonoid M] [Module R M] [Module.Free R M] [Nontrivial M] :
    FaithfulSMul R M := .ofInjective _ (Module.Free.repr R M).symm.injective
```
